During his time at university, Law discovered his true calling was in acting and began to take acting classes. He left Bristol University without completing his degree and moved to London to pursue a career in the performing arts.

Law's professional acting career began in the early 1990s with small roles on stage and screen. His breakthrough came in 1997 when he played the lead role of Dickie Greenleaf in Anthony Minghella's film adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's novel "The Talented Mr. Ripley". The film earned him critical acclaim and recognition in the industry.

Throughout his career, Law has appeared in a wide range of films, including "Cold Mountain", "Closer", "Road to Perdition", "The Grand Budapest Hotel", "Sherlock Holmes", and "Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald". He has received numerous award nominations and wins, including an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

In addition to his film work, Law has had a successful career in theatre, appearing in productions such as "Hamlet", "Henry V", and "Anna Christie". He has also been involved in various stage productions, including the Royal Shakespeare Company.

Law is known for his versatility and ability to take on a wide range of roles. He has been praised for his performances, which often convey a deep sense of vulnerability and sensitivity. Throughout his career, Law has established himself as one of the most respected and talented actors of his generation.

In his personal life, Law has been married twice, first to Sadie Frost, with whom he has three children, and then to Phillipa Coan, with whom he has two children.
